titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: In August 1991, Keystone Cogenerations Systems Inc. was granted Coastal Zone and subaqueous land permits by the Delaware Department of Natural Resources and Environmental Control, allowing the company to build a coal-fired electric and steam generating plant in Logan Township, New Jersey, and a 1,600-foot pier into the Delaware River. Seven environmental activists appealed the permits and after a legal labyrinth, negotiated a tough settlement that brought some environmental clout and establishment of a trust fund "to be used for projects benefitting the environment." The Greenwatch Institute administers those funds, and its archives include the legal briefs, correspondence, bylays, and reports documenting establishment of the Institute.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the records of the Greenwatch Institute. Materials include: correspondence; bylaws; court briefs and other legal papers; reports; and printed material. The collection also contains materials related to the Salem nuclear power plant and the Brandywine & Christina Rivers Task Force.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
